scenario_text.value:
(It’s obvious how screwy things are between
Shuuji and Lopmon, even from the outside.)
(How are Aoi and Labramon doing, I wonder?)

Let’s see, with these ingredients... How
about grilled fish with a salad?

Hmm, but the nutritional value will be off
without some meat in there...

Then...maybe a veggie stir-fry? But what
seasoning would work?
I’ll help out, Aoi!

Thanks, Labramon. Could you carry the
vegetables to that box over there?
Leave it to me!
What’re you doing, Aoi?

Hey, Takuma. I’m just pondering over today’s
menu.

I want to help everyone, but this is about
all I can do...

Don’t sell yourself short. What you can do in
a kitchen is pretty awesome.

But I clam up in group discussions, and if
I do end up talking, it’s always negative...

And in the end, I just go along with other
opinions. I can’t do a thing.
Oh, Takuma, what am I to this group?

(Aoi’s gotten so negative. I have to do
something to lift her spirits.)

(She’s...kind, and good at cooking. Like
a mom, maybe? Naw, that’s weird.)

(She’s serious and dependable, just like
a class president should be, right?)

(She’s a mediator, or a coordinator... Oh?
Coordinator’s sounds pretty cool, right?)
(To me, Aoi is...)
A mom, in a good way.
Our class president.
Like a coordinator?
A mom...
What? Me, a mom?
Oh, um! Maybe I’m oversimplifying...
What’s a “mahm”?
First I’ve heard of it.

A mom is...someone who gives birth to kids?
No, that’s not quite right...

They’re kind, they protect everyone. Just
having them around puts you at ease...
Huh, puts you at ease...

Um, so I’m just saying! Your kindness, the
way you feed us, it’s like that!
Hee-hee... Hee-hee-hee...
Aoi?
Heheh, sorry, it’s just... Ahaha...

It makes me happy to know you think of me
that way, Takuma.
Yeah? Happy? Then that works for me...
Heheh, Mama Aoi...

You’re our class president through and
through, Aoi.

You’re serious, and you take us to task when
we need it.
Huh... So I’m the same way over here, too?
What?

A good little girl. Inflexible and super
serious.

Delegating all the difficult work to myself.
Taking all the responsibility.
That’s... That’s just too...

Um, Aoi? Was it something I said? You all
right?
Ah...
Sorry. It’s nothing to worry about...
Aoi, you’re white as a sheet! What’s wrong?!
I’m fine, really...

(I feel like I said something I shouldn’t
have.)

You’re everyone’s coordinator, Aoi. You help
mesh all our different opinions together.

Hmm. I feel like that role suits you more
than it suits me, don’t you think?
Huh? Me?

Yes. Someone who pulls people together, and
gets everyone on the same page.
More of a leader than a coordinator, even.

Seriously? I don’t see that in myself at all,
though...

If you’re not doing it on purpose, then it
suits you all the more.

I’d say I’m...more of a secretary, or an
aide. A support role, maybe.

At any rate, I just have to do what I can for
now. I’ll have time to worry later.

I’ll get back to work. Thanks for talking to
me, Takuma.

(I had no idea Aoi was worrying about her own
sense of identity...)

(Still, I can’t stick to my preconceived
notions now.)

(Aoi is just a girl one year older than me.
I’ll have to remember that.)

I’ll work hard on the things I can do at the
moment. Thank you, Takuma.
